Race.SpecificTitle: City Judge -- City Court, ES 2E, City of Baton Rouge
Zachary Community School System -- 38.2 Mills - SB - 10 Yr.
Race.SummaryText:
Zachary Community School System Proposition
(Millage Renewal)

Summary:  10-year 38.2-mills renewal property tax for the purpose of giving additional support to the public elementary and secondary schools of the Zachary Community School System and for any of its lawful school purposes, including acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and operating the public elementary and secondary schools and school-related buildings, equipment and facilities of the system and paying the salaries and benefits of school system personnel.
Race.FullText: Shall the Zachary Community School System, in the Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana (the "System"), continue to levy a thirty-eight and two-tenths (38.2) mills tax on all property subject to taxation in said System for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2014 and ending with the year 2023 (an estimated $7,500,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), inclusive, for the purpose of giving additional support to the public elementary and secondary schools of the Zachary Community School System and for any of its lawful school purposes, including acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and operating the public elementary and secondary schools and school-related buildings, equipment and facilities of the System and paying the salaries and benefits of school system personnel?

Race.SpecificTitle: Melrose East Crime Prevention Dist. -- Parcel Fee - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Melrose East Crime Prevention District Proposition

Summary:  10-year annual parcel fee of up to $200 for residential parcels and an initial fee of up to $500 for commercial parcels beginning in 2013 to aid in crime prevention and to add to the security of District residents by increasing the presence of law enforcement personnel in the District which initial fee on commercial parcels may be increased by not more than 5% per year.
Race.FullText: Shall Melrose East Crime Prevention District ("District") be authorized to levy an annual parcel fee of up to two hundred dollars ($200) per improved residential parcel and an initial parcel fee of up to five hundred dollars ($500) per improved commercial parcel located in the District for a period of ten (10) years, beginning in 2013 and ending in 2022, to aid in crime prevention and to add to the security of District residents by increasing the presence of law enforcement personnel in the District and for all purposes set forth in La. R.S. 33:9097.7 and be authorized to increase the initial parcel fee on improved commercial parcels by not more than 5% per year (an estimated $75,100 is reasonably expected to be collected from the initial levy)?

Race.SummaryText:
Mayfair Park/Mayfair Park East/Mayfair Heights Crime Prevention Improvement District Proposition

Summary:  Authorization for the Mayfair Park/Mayfair Park East/Mayfair Heights Crime Prevention Improvement District to levy an annual parcel fee of $144 for each parcel of improved land located in the boundaries of the district for a period of five (5) years commencing on January 1, 2013, owned by a person under the age of sixty-five at the time of voter approval; to be used to aid in crime prevention and enhance security of district residents by providing for an increase of law enforcement personnel or contracted security personnel in the district and other purposes permitted by applicable law within the Mayfair Park/Mayfair Park East/Mayfair Heights Crime Prevention Improvement District.
Race.FullText: Shall Mayfair Park/Mayfair Park East/Mayfair Heights Crime Prevention Improvement District, acting through the Board of Commissioners of the District be authorized to levy an annual parcel fee of One Hundred Forty-Four Dollars ($144.00) on each improved parcel located within the boundaries of the District, less and except any parcel whose owner is sixty-five or older at the time of voter approval, for a period of five (5) years, beginning in 2013 and ending in 2017 (an estimated $61,871 is reasonably expected to be collected from the initial levy), which fee shall be collected by any means authorized by law for the collection of taxes, all as provided by La. R.S. 33:9097.13, with the proceeds of said fee (after deducting the reasonable and necessary costs of collecting said fee) to be used to aid in crime prevention and enhance security of District residents by providing for an increase of law enforcement personnel or contracted security personnel in the District and for other purposes permitted by applicable law. Provides that it is the purpose and intent that the additional law enforcement personnel and their services provided through the fee shall be supplemental to and not in lieu of personnel and services provided in the district by the city and parish.  Provides that if the district ceases to exist, district funds shall be transmitted to the governing authority of East Baton Rouge Parish and requires that such funds be used for law enforcement purposes in the area included within the district.
